'Makatea', or 'Mangaia-te-vai-tamae', is a raised coral atoll in the
northwestern part of the Tuamotus, which is a part of the French overseas
collectivity of French Polynesia. It is located 79 km southwest from
Rangiroa to the west of the Palliser group, which also is in French Polynesia.
Makatea is surrounded by spectacular cliffs, rising to a plateau 80 m above sea
level. This island is 7.5 km long, with a maximum width of 7 km in the
south. It is 24 kmÂ² in area. Makatea is one of the only four islands of the
Tuamotu Archipelago (along with Nukutavake, Tikei, and Tepoto Nord) that do not
take the form of a typical atoll.
